# calloutElementForAnnotation(annotation)

**Interface Method**

Returns an element representing a custom callout.

## Declaration

```swift
calloutElementForAnnotation?(annotation: Annotation): HTMLElement;
```

## Parameters

- **annotation**: The annotation for the callout.

## Return Value

This method returns a DOM element to use as the callout element in place of the standard callout bubble. This callout element populates with the information to display, including the information from the annotation.

## Discussion

If you don’t prevent the callout from appearing, MapKit JS calls this method on the annotation’s callout delegate (if the delegate is an object and its [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/AnnotationCalloutDelegate/calloutElementForAnnotation] property is a function) with the annotation as a parameter.

## Providing elements

- **calloutContentForAnnotation(annotation)**: Returns custom content for the callout bubble.
- **calloutLeftAccessoryForAnnotation(annotation)**: Returns an element to use as a custom accessory on the left side of the callout content area.
- **calloutRightAccessoryForAnnotation(annotation)**: Returns an element to use as a custom accessory on the right side of the callout content area.
